trends.title: Funding landscape evolving: REITs, private credit, and flexible funding gain traction in India
trends.summary: The Indian funding landscape is evolving with the rise of alternative investment options. REITs are emerging as an alternative to mutual funds, offering transparency and rental income. A report indicates India needs $750 million in flexible funding to build 100 'non-profit unicorns'. Motilal Oswal Alternates has raised Rs 1,700 crore for its India Credit Excellence Fund, targeting a corpus of Rs 3,000 crore to support mid-market enterprises. SEBI is introducing Life Cycle Funds, as explained by Radhika Gupta of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, simplifying long-term investing.
keywords: Securities and Exchange Board of India
trends.actionable_insight: Motilal Oswal Alternates has raised Rs 1,700 crore for its India Credit Excellence Fund, signaling increased availability of private credit for mid-market enterprises in India.
causal_chain: FACT: Motilal Oswal Alternates raised Rs 1,700 crore for its India Credit Excellence Fund.
FIRST-ORDER: Mid-market enterprises across sectors gain access to secured financing and bespoke capital solutions.
SECOND-ORDER: Scaling mid-market enterprises (50-500 employees) can expand operations, invest in technology, and increase market share.
DECISION POINT: Mid-market enterprises must decide whether to pursue debt financing from private credit funds like Motilal Oswal's to fund growth initiatives.

trends.title: Supreme Court Interventions: Textbook Ban and Aravalli Hills Definition Review
trends.summary: The Supreme Court (SC) has taken action on two separate matters. First, the SC banned a National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) Class 8 textbook due to a section on 'corruption in judiciary,' with the Centre apologizing. The SC also issued a contempt of court notice to the Department of School Education and the director of NCERT. Second, the SC asked the Centre to suggest names of experts for a panel to re-examine the definition of Aravalli Hills and extended the interim stay on mining activities in the region. These interventions highlight the SC's role in overseeing educational content and environmental regulations.
trends.actionable_insight: The Supreme Court's intervention in textbook content and environmental regulations creates a need for educational publishers and mining companies to closely monitor regulatory changes and ensure compliance to avoid legal challenges.
causal_chain: FACT: SC banned NCERT Class 8 book with section on ‘corruption in judiciary’ and issued a contempt of court notice to the Department of School Education and the director of NCERT.
FIRST-ORDER: NCERT and the Department of School Education must revise the Class 8 textbook and respond to the contempt of court notice, potentially facing legal repercussions.
SECOND-ORDER: Textbook publishers and curriculum developers (10-50 employees) may face increased scrutiny and potential legal challenges related to content deemed inappropriate by the courts.
DECISION POINT: Textbook publishers need to review existing content and implement stricter editorial controls to ensure compliance with legal and ethical standards.

event_5w1h.why: Textbook content was deemed inappropriate, and the definition of Aravalli Hills needed re-examination.
event_5w1h.how: The Supreme Court intervened directly, issuing bans, notices, and requests to relevant bodies.

trends.title: India and Israel strengthen ties with FTA talks and bilateral agreements
trends.summary: India and Israel are deepening their strategic partnership through FTA negotiations and various bilateral agreements. The first round of FTA negotiations has commenced in New Delhi, focusing on technology and trade cooperation. Prime Minister Modi's visit concluded with the unveiling of 27 agreements covering defense, technology, trade, UPI, and regional connectivity. These developments aim to enhance economic ties and cooperation between the two nations, impacting businesses involved in technology, defense, and trade.
trends.actionable_insight: India and Israel have initiated FTA negotiations and signed 27 bilateral agreements, including cooperation in AI, creating opportunities for technology and trade companies to expand into each other's markets.
causal_chain: FACT: India and Israel started FTA negotiations in New Delhi ahead of PM Modi's visit.
FIRST-ORDER: Indian and Israeli technology and trade companies anticipate reduced tariffs and increased export opportunities.
SECOND-ORDER: Small and medium-sized technology firms (10-50 employees) in both countries need to adapt their market entry strategies to capitalize on the FTA's benefits.
DECISION POINT: Technology companies need to assess the impact of the FTA on their competitive positioning and adjust their market entry strategies accordingly.

trends.title: Financial Fraud and Data Breaches Impacting Banks and Customers
trends.summary: Several incidents of financial fraud and data breaches have surfaced, impacting banks and their customers. IDFC First Bank is dealing with a ₹590-crore scam, raising concerns about financial fallout and depositor confidence. YES Bank experienced a data breach on BookMyForex cards, leading to fraudulent transactions worth ₹7.63 Cr. Customers of BookMyForex are reporting unauthorized transactions and a lack of accountability. Sebi has warned investors against fake STT notices and market scams, highlighting impersonation of officials and misuse of names.
keywords: Securities and Exchange Board of India

trends.title: India's Policy Push: AI, Digitalization, and Manufacturing Incentives Drive Investment
trends.summary: India is aggressively pursuing policies to attract investment and boost domestic production across various sectors. The government is focusing on AI, digitalization, and manufacturing incentives. The Asian Development Bank (ADB) highlights India's stable environment and pro-business approach in generative AI data centers and critical mineral processing as key draws for private sector investment. Indian Railways launched a Rail Tech Policy to co-fund startup innovations and digitize the Railway Claims Tribunal. Tripura is unveiling an AI policy with assistance from Niti Aayog. The Centre is piloting CBDC-based food subsidies under PMGKAY in Puducherry on February 26.
trends.actionable_insight: Indian Railways has launched a Rail Tech Policy to co-fund startup innovations. This creates a competitive environment for railway technology startups seeking funding and partnerships, requiring them to differentiate their offerings and stay updated on the latest technological advancements.
causal_chain: FACT: Indian Railways launched a Rail Tech Policy to co-fund startup innovations and digitize the Railway Claims Tribunal.
FIRST-ORDER: Railway-focused startups can receive co-funding for prototype development and trials, potentially accelerating innovation in railway technology.
SECOND-ORDER: Small and medium-sized railway technology startups (10-50 employees) now face increased competition to secure funding and partnerships with Indian Railways.
DECISION POINT: Startup founders need competitive intelligence on other startups and technology research to identify gaps in the market and position their offerings effectively to Indian Railways.

trends.title: Crocs Expands India Presence: Tier 2 Cities, Gen-Z Focus, and Local Production
trends.summary: Crocs is expanding its presence in India, targeting Tier 2 cities and Gen-Z consumers. The company operates approximately 300 mono-brand or exclusive stores across 115 Indian cities, primarily through a partnership with Metro Brands. Crocs is also focusing on Gen-Z marketing, launching India-themed ‘Jibbitz’, and scaling its newly acquired casual shoes brand Hey Dude after stabilizing it in the US. Crocs entered India in 2007 and currently has five factories there, up from two in 2023. The company is considering further capacity expansion in India due to tariff volatility and sourcing shifts.
trends.actionable_insight: Crocs is expanding its presence in India, focusing on Tier 2 cities and Gen-Z consumers, which will likely increase competition for existing footwear retailers in those markets. Crocs has increased its factory count in India from two in 2023 to five.
causal_chain: FACT: Crocs operates about 300 mono-brand or exclusive stores across 115 Indian cities.
FIRST-ORDER: Metro Brands, Crocs' primary retail partner in India, will see increased sales volume and potentially need to expand its own distribution network to support Crocs' Tier 2 expansion.

SECOND-ORDER: Small to medium-sized retailers in Tier 2 cities (10-50 employees) face increased competition from Crocs' expanded presence, potentially impacting their market share in the footwear segment.
DECISION POINT: Retailers in Tier 2 cities need Competitive Intelligence to understand Crocs' pricing strategy and marketing tactics to develop counter-strategies to retain customers.

trends.title: AI Enthusiasm Wanes: Nvidia Results Mixed, Salesforce Guidance Weak, Market Reacts
trends.summary: The market is showing signs of cooling enthusiasm for AI, despite strong earnings from Nvidia. Nvidia's stock reaction was muted after reporting strong growth, led by continued demand for AI and sharp expansion in its data center business. Salesforce shares are down 4% pre-market at $183.79 due to weak sales growth outlook and concerns over AI competition. This has raised concerns for software and SaaS companies, including Indian IT firms. The Nifty 50 is consolidating near 25,500, and analysts expect sentiment to stay fragile in the near term, with a possible decline towards 25,300.
trends.actionable_insight: Salesforce's shares dropped 4% after a lukewarm sales growth outlook, signaling concerns over AI competition and affecting investor sentiment towards software and SaaS companies, including Indian IT firms.
causal_chain: FACT: Nvidia reported strong growth in AI and data center business, but the stock reaction was muted.

FIRST-ORDER: Investors are concerned that Nvidia's growth is already priced into the stock, leading to a 3.6% drop in share price (Wall Street: S&P 500, Nasdaq slip as concerns over AI bubble weigh, Nvidia sinks 3.6%).

SECOND-ORDER: Salesforce shares are down 4% premarket due to weak sales growth outlook and concerns over AI competition. This affects investor sentiment towards software and SaaS companies, including Indian IT firms.

DECISION POINT: Indian IT firms tracking global trends must assess their AI strategies and competitive positioning in light of Salesforce's weak guidance and the overall market's waning enthusiasm for AI.

trends.title: Nvidia's Stellar Q4 Results Defy AI Bubble Worries, Market Reacts
trends.summary: Nvidia reported a strong fourth-quarter performance, with a 73% year-on-year surge in revenue, reaching $68.1 billion. Jensen Huang, Nvidia's CEO, stated that AI will only improve. Despite the positive earnings report, the stock market reacted with some volatility, with Nvidia stock falling after the earnings announcement. This mixed reaction highlights the market's sensitivity to AI-related stocks and the ongoing debate about a potential AI bubble. The market is closely watching Nvidia's performance as a bellwether for the AI sector.
trends.actionable_insight: Nvidia's Q4 revenue surged 73% year-on-year to $68.1 billion, but the stock market reacted with volatility, indicating uncertainty about the sustainability of the AI boom.
causal_chain: FACT: Nvidia posted a 73% year-on-year surge in its fourth quarter fiscal revenue at $68.1 billion.
FIRST-ORDER: Investors reacted to Nvidia's earnings report, with the stock initially falling after the announcement.

DECISION POINT: Investors and analysts need to assess the long-term sustainability of the AI boom and its impact on Nvidia's future performance.

trends.title: Indian IT grapples with AI adoption: TCS urges AI use, Murthy issues warning
trends.summary: Indian IT companies are navigating the complexities of AI adoption. TCS CEO Krithivasan is urging senior employees to develop AI solutions, while Narayana Murthy is advising youngsters to master AI but remain cautious. A Mint Explainer highlights uncertainty in the sector, noting a potential $45 billion market cap loss in 2026. Karnataka is developing an ethical AI framework and hosting GAFX 2026 to showcase AI-led content creation. Wingify's Paras Chopra emphasizes the need for a builder's mindset over short-term profit.

trends.title: India's GDP Calculation Revision: New Base Year and Data Concerns
trends.summary: India is revising its GDP calculation methodology, shifting to a new base year of 2022-23, replacing the 2011-12 base. This change aims to capture the economy more accurately by incorporating new data sources like GST and E-Vahan data, and accounting for domestic workers. The revision addresses data quality concerns raised over the years. However, a Mint poll suggests GDP growth may have slowed to 7.4% in Q3 due to slower government spending and weak exports, even as SBI estimates 8.1% growth in the December quarter and 7.7-7.8% for the full fiscal year. SEBI data indicates a drop in retail trading participation, with only 33% of India’s 220 million demat accounts active as of January 2026.
keywords: Securities and Exchange Board of India
trends.actionable_insight: India is transitioning to a new GDP base year (2022-23), which will necessitate a reassessment of economic models and investment strategies by financial institutions and corporations. SEBI data also indicates a decline in retail trading participation, signaling a potential shift in market dynamics.
causal_chain: FACT: India is shifting to a new GDP base year of 2022-23, replacing 2011-12.
FIRST-ORDER: Businesses face uncertainty in economic forecasting due to the change in GDP calculation methodology.
SECOND-ORDER: Financial institutions and investment firms (50-500 employees) need to recalibrate their economic models and investment strategies based on the new GDP series.
DECISION POINT: Investment firms need to decide whether to update their economic models in-house or outsource to firms specializing in economic data analysis and forecasting.

trends.title: Electric Two-Wheeler Market Expansion: New Launches, Orders, and Geographic Reach
trends.summary: The electric two-wheeler market is experiencing growth through product launches, order acquisitions, and geographic expansion. A-1 Sureja Industries launched its 'Yellow EV' brand and secured orders for 1,400 electric two-wheelers. Greaves Cotton's EV arm, Ampere, expanded to Nepal and launched its flagship e-scooter, Ampere Nexus, recognized for its performance on challenging routes in India. trends.title: AI and IoT Startups Secure Seed Funding for Expansion and Product Development
trends.summary: Several startups, particularly in the AI and IoT sectors, have recently secured seed funding rounds. MeltPlan, an AI-native preconstruction startup founded by Innovaccer co-founder Kanav Hasija, raised $10 million in seed funding led by Bessemer Venture Partners. Gushwork AI, an Agentic AI startup, raised $9 million in its seed round led by Susquehanna Asia VC. Spintly, an IoT and physical security startup headquartered in Goa, raised $8 million in a funding round led by Accel. Prayaan Capital secured Rs 110 Cr in Series A funding led by Peak XV Partners. These investments aim to fuel product development, expand teams, and broaden market reach.

trends.title: Regulatory Changes Impacting Food, Finance, Aviation, and Energy Sectors in India
trends.summary: Several regulatory changes are impacting various sectors in India. FSSAI is mandating daily records for food businesses, potentially affecting MSMEs. SEBI is capping mutual fund overlap at 50% for sectoral and thematic equity schemes and tightening social media norms for registered entities. The DGCA has modified ticket refund rules, allowing 48-hour free cancellations. The government is mandating the sale of E20 petrol with a minimum RON of 95 from April 1. These changes aim to strengthen enforcement, protect investors, and promote ease of doing business.

trends.title: Indian Startup Funding Landscape: AI Leads 23% Jump in 2025
trends.summary: In 2025, Indian tech startups experienced a 23% increase in funding, reaching $9.1 billion, with AI leading the shift. This surge is accompanied by a 68% jump in startup patent filings since 2020-21, indicating a focus on proprietary technology. Several startups secured funding, including ZeroHarm Sciences raising ₹65 Cr ($7.2 Mn), Tattvam AI securing $1.7 million, and Companion Labs raising $2.5 Mn (₹22.7 Cr). Sauce.vc closed a ₹750 Cr fund, and Info Edge committed ₹250 Cr to B8 Fund I, signaling continued investment in the tech startup ecosystem.
trends.actionable_insight: Indian tech startups saw a 23% funding increase in 2025, reaching $9.1 billion, with AI leading the surge. This is coupled with a 68% increase in patent filings since 2020-21, indicating a strong focus on proprietary technology and creating a competitive environment for early-stage startups.
causal_chain: FACT: Indian tech startups raised $9.1 billion in 2025, a 23% jump, with AI leading the shift.
FIRST-ORDER: Start-up patent filings have jumped around 68% since 2020–21, reflecting a growing focus on building proprietary technology.
SECOND-ORDER: AI startups like Tattvam AI and Companion Labs are securing funding, indicating investor confidence in the sector. Supplement startups like ZeroHarm Sciences are also expanding.
DECISION POINT: Startups need to decide how to allocate the increased funding to maximize growth and innovation, while investors need to identify promising startups for future investments.

trends.title: upGrad Acquires Internshala to Expand Edtech and Talent Acquisition Pipeline
trends.summary: Edtech platform upGrad has acquired a 90% stake in Gurugram-based internship platform Internshala for an undisclosed amount via stock swap transactions. The acquisition aims to combine Internshala’s internship platform with upGrad’s educational offerings, focusing on cross-selling services. This allows students to access skilling certifications and degree pathways while providing both businesses with a streamlined talent acquisition pipeline.
